The NYC General Assembly is composed of dozens of groups working together to organize and set the vision for the #occupywallstreet movement. This is our official website.

You are browsing the archive for General Assembly.

← Previous Entries

by nycga

General Assembly Minutes 7pm 9/23/11

October 13, 2011 in General Assembly, Minutes

GA minutes 09/23/11

Review of Process (Hand Signals and their Meaning)

Working Group Report Backs:

Medic – Needs more people with medical experience that are willing to help or at least more people to undergo training to be part of the Medic Working Group.

Internet – Announced that they are now working closely with occupywallst.org (http://occupywallst NULL.org/) to ensure information is spread to the public.

Legal – Announced that there would be a proposal later in the GA regaurding a retainer with a law firm and it’s implications on the occupation.

Arts – Announced that on Saturday (09/24/11) at 2:30PM there would be a small concert for those interested in hearing music. Also, on Sunday (09/25/11) at 1PM there would be a one man theater.

Direct Action – Announced that they would be giving a presentation later in the meeting on Solidarity and the Police.

Rain Committee – Called for volunteers that were willing to take people in for the evening so that they could rest and be dry. Also, there is a nearby shelter that could potentially take in around 20 individuals.

Principles of Consolidation – Announced that they would be presenting a second working draft of our Principles of Solidarity and would be submitting a proposal pertaining to it.

Town Planning – Called for a discussion on the issue of dogs in the plaza.

Facilitation Committee – Announced that there would be facilitation training at 12PM and 6PM for those who would like to take in active roll in helping to run general assemblies.

Announcements:

Kevin – Is putting together and zine and has called for submissions of writing and art and has welcomed anyone to join him in helping to put it together.

Eric – Voiced his concern about the ‘message’ of the movement, explaining that he feels that it is important to have a more defined goal (referring to Wall St).

Louise – Suggested that the Occupy Wall Street movement setup an Open Forum to field questions and educate the general populace about what we are doing.

Lorenzo – Asked that everyone to be proactive about educating themselves about the movement and all aspects of it to better understand its purpose.

Corelle – Announced that there would be a support group meeting for those with faith.

Robert – Announced he would be leading a teach-in about the corruption of the ‘Bank of America’, infront of one of the branches after the GA.

Max – Made a requested for individuals who was interested in being interviewed about their experiences with the OWS movement and how those pertain to other global movements.

Jesse – Announced that there would be a Day of Action against Global Warming and Climate Change at the UN, Saturday (09/24/11) at 2PM.

Amanda – Announced that there will be a teach-in on Feminism and invited people to seeker her out for more information.

Matt – Suggested that Out Reach be present at concerts in NYC to spread the message of OWS.

Peter – Purposed that there be a designated smoking.

Ted – Called for more tech support for the group.

There was another announcement made out of order during the agenda that will be presented here: An arrestee support group has been established and encourages anyone who has been arrested or may be arrested to seek them out.

Agenda:

Legal – Proposed that the group cancel its retainer with a specific law firm based on various reason and moved to have consesus after explaining the situation in depth. Consesus was reached and it was decided that the retainer would be canceled.

Principles of Consolidation:

Proposed that the second draft of our Principals of Solidarity be posted online to show the online community and the world at large that steps are being take to better refine the message of the movement.

Many individuals voiced concerns including; no mention of the environment, issues with the language used and how it might be percieved and the concern that a ‘draft’ should not be the first submission presented to the world at large.

After some in depth and important information it was explained that the document would be a ‘living’ document, a draft for our unifying principals, that is being proposed to be posted online. There was a move for consensus but there were four blocks.

The first block, regarding the use of the phrase ‘redistribution of wealth’ and how it sounded dangerously similar to theft, explained their position. After it was decided, via consensus, that that particuplar item would be removed before posting online, the block was removed.

A second block was made regaurding the importance of ensuring this document was ‘open source’. After the sentiment was echoed by the group it was explained that the document would be ‘open source’ to as fully and extent as possible. The block was then removed.

A third block was presented but then removed due to a misunderstanding.

A fourth block was presented pointing out that the media would misinterperet or not understand the document in its current form. The individual blocking proposed that the document not be put online until a finalized list of demands could be made. After much negotiation and discussion, the importance and urgency of getting something to the public was stressed and eventually the block was removed.

The GA then moved again for consesus and everyone was thrilled that consensus had been reached, the document would be posted online, in one of the most beautiful examples of a true democracy that I, personally, have ever seen.

Direct Action – Gave a presentation on the importance of recognizing privelage and how that pertains to an individuals perception of the police. It was also stressed, in a very well worded essay, that not everyone views the police as being on our side and that that view point is a completely valid and nessecary .

At the closing of the General Assembly a donated of symbolic food from Japanese refugees was presented to the group in an act of solidarity to our purpose and struggle.

by nycga

General Assembly Minutes 9/28 7:30PM

October 13, 2011 in General Assembly, Minutes

General Assembly 9/28 7:30PM

Intro

For everyone who has never been to a general assembly, they will go through a brief process explanation.

There is an agenda that is brief and timed. They will take proposals for those agenda items, then we will take friendly amendments, then clarifying questions about those proposals, then they will take concerns, then they will move to blocks. Blocks are very serious. It means that you have an ethical or principal problem with what is being proposed, or you think it’s bad for the group.

Continue reading → (http://nycga NULL.cc/2011/09/28/general-assembly-minutes-928-730pm/#more-734)

General Assembly Minutes 10/10/11 7PM

October 10, 2011 in General Assembly, Minutes

General Assembly Day 24 begins in 4 mins!
Please take your seats!

Introduction of Facilitation Team:
Craig, Daniel – facilitators
Eileen – stack (progressive)
Vinny – time-keeper

If you’d like drummers to stop, you may (politely) ask them. (lots of spirit fingers)

This is a projector screen.

If you’re in front of me, please sit down.

Mic check: “I asked the drummers to stop, but they said it’s a sacred dance and won’t stop”

Is it ok?

We will continue.

100 transport workers refuse to bring protestors to jail, and are filing a restraining order against the NYPD!

 

Are there any concerns regarding Amanda and Bre as facilitators for this general assembly?

No!

 

We’d like to begin by introducing the process.

General Assembly Minutes 10/3 7:30

October 3, 2011 in General Assembly, Minutes

October 2, 2011 Minutes:

Wanted to make sure that we the people are okay with the people up front running it.

The people up front are facilitators. Anyone can facilitate if they get in touch with the working group.

Bri: Is a co-facilitator. She wants consent on weather of not we agree for them to be facilitators.

Everyone wants the one complaining to sit down.

Bri. Are there ary outstanding concersn with them being facilitators.

NO!

General Assembly Minutes 10/2 7:30PM

October 2, 2011 in General Assembly, Minutes

We have a welcome table and an info table. If you want to help out go see either table. They got information, they can point you in the right way. We also have working groups. Join a working group. Working groups are autonomous. They do great things. Come and help out. You can get that info at either of those tables. We also have some thematic groups. Those groups are around issues. So if you want to talk about issues, join a thematic working group. My name is Nalini. Continue reading → (http://nycga NULL.cc/2011/10/02/general-assembly-minutes-102-7pm/#more-844)

by nycga

General Assembly Minutes 10/1 7:30PM

October 1, 2011 in General Assembly, Minutes

Because hundreds of us got arrested, GA will be a little bit different.

First, a review of procedures.

Then we will have working group report backs.

After that, announcements!

For working group report backs, we’re going to give priority to Legal and Direct Action to report back on what happened today.

REVIEW OF PROCESS.

Two generations of people’s mic will be required! This means that the crowd repeats what the speaker says, and the crowd further back repeats that.
